comments.content:
While working on a project I discovered several bugs in the externs files.
Attached is a small patch. Please review and apply to closure-compiler.

I did the following changes:

* Added type "Image" to HTML5 drawImage method. This method accepts HTML
Image elements but also images created by "new Image()". Without this fix
the compiler throws an error because I can't pass "Image" to drawImage. An
alternative fix would be letting Image extend HTMLImageElement (I'm not
sure if this is the real specification of Image).

* Removed the unannotated Window.prototype.removeEventListener so Window
uses the correctly annotated Node.prototype.removeEventListener instead.

* Added type annotation to Element.prototype.tagName.

* Added missing parameter and return value annotation to prompt function.

Thanks for the patch! Before we can accept the patch, we need you to sign a CLA. The 
CLA basically says that you own the copyright on any code you submit, and it's ok if 
our project uses it. You can fill it out online here:

http://code.google.com/legal/individual-cla-v1.0.html

if you work at a company that owns the rights to your code, you'll also need a 
corporate CLA. if you don't know if you should sign this or not, you should ask your 
employer.

http://code.google.com/legal/corporate-cla-v1.0.html

Let me know if you have any questions about any of this.

I have confirm the author has signed the CLA.

Nick did you want to be the shepherd, if this is still relavent?
This issue was closed by revision r471.
